column3: any implementation of a mathematical function (not strictly limited to python functions that are implemented using "def")
any implementation of a mathematical set (not strictly limited to python `set`)
as per Stepanov (2009), any function that maps to and from objects of the same type
any nonset that is used to construct a mathematical set
any element or set that is contained within a mathematical set
a python string
a python dictionary
a python list
a python class
an instance of a python class
a context-free grammar as understood in the theory of computation
a representation of a rule in a context-free grammar
a string comprised of natural language
a string composed entirely of nonwhitespace characters
an indivisible unit of articulation that can be combined with others to create a phone, such as voicing, manner of articulation, etc.
an indivisible unit of sound capable creating distinction in meaning in any attested natural language. it is a product of "features": manner, place, voicing, etc.
an indivisible unit of sound capable of conveying meaning in any attested natural language. it is a product of phonemes.
an indivisible unit of meaning that fully describes the meaning of any morpheme in any attested natural language. it is a product of episemes.
an indivisible unit of distinction between any set of morphemes or their arrangement in any attested natural language.
an indivisible unit of meaning that is mutually exclusive to other members in a episemaxis
any indivisible unit that is associated with a predefined token, such as a phone, morph, seme, tag, etc.
an indivisible unit within the context of a specific language, such as a phoneme, morpheme, etc.
a set of sets that each contain terms
a cartesian product of axes
a subset of a space
a member of a space
a sequence of points within a space
an operation between spaces
a representation of a collection of any kind in memory, including spaces, masks, paths, sets, fields, etc.
any store that allows traversal but forbids tests of membership in the interest of performance
any store that forbids traversal but allows tests of membership
any store that represents a function
a store of nested series
a member of a tree
a mask that specifies elements that are included in a store
a mask that specifies elements that are excluded in a store
a path that specifies the order in which inflections are to be demonstrated
a technique for representing and iterating through dictionaries, typically in a dictset or dictspace
a technique for interpreting cells within a table as dictionaries
a technique for interpreting annotations as the contents of stores
a technique for creating new stores given annotations an evaluations
a tree where nodes are lists or strings
a tree where nodes are rules
a listtree that represents meaning in a language agnostic fashion that's standardized across this body of work
a function that, when given a context, maps between nodes of a tree
an operation that acts on trees
a language-specific nodemap that applies fields mapping episememepoints to tagmemes, representing definitions for things like case or mood in the language
a language-specific nodemap of lists that applies fields mapping tagmemepoints to text, representing inflection in the language
a language-specific operation that acts on ruletrees, representing things like sentence structure or noun phrase ordering in a language
a set of characters
a function that, when given a script, maps a syntax tree to text
a tuple of language and script
the representation of a seme in a given orthography
an Anki card, which consists of a series of demonstrations that each represent the same seme
an Anki deck, which consists of cards that demonstrate the same type of inflection, such as verb conjugation, noun declension, etc.
